Posts.Content: DancingVeggie wrote: I am just curious about anyone who has beaten their mets and is on some type of maintenance but is ER+ and HER2-.  I feel like all the NED ladies are HER2+ and are on Herceptin, but what about the rest of us? Anyone not on Tamoxifen?  That didn't keep me from getting mets, so that's off the table for me. Please share with me your details.  Thanks so much! Dx 10/6/2008, IDC, 4cm, Stage IIA, Grade 2, 0/3 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Chemotherapy 12/16/2008 AC Chemotherapy 2/3/2009 Taxol (paclitaxel) Radiation Therapy 4/15/2009 Breast Hormonal Therapy 5/30/2009 Dx 10/24/2012, 6cm+, Stage IV, mets, ER+/PR-, HER2- Targeted Therapy 11/4/2012 Avastin (bevacizumab) Chemotherapy 11/4/2012 Taxol (paclitaxel) Chemotherapy 9/22/2013 Xeloda (capecitabine) Hormonal Therapy 3/9/2014 Arimidex (anastrozole) Chemotherapy 6/24/2014 Halaven (eribulin) Chemotherapy 8/17/2014 Carboplatin (Paraplatin), Gemzar (gemcitabine) Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: NED, ER+/HER2-? Are you out there? I want to know you! DancingVeggie Stormynyte

Posts.Content: DancingVeggie wrote: Hi! So I had some terrible swelling and pain when I was diagnosed, which went away after the first cycle...but now I've been feeling pain again. Any of you have experience with recurring pain with liver mets? Does this mean getting worse or getting better? I have scans in two weeks but I'm anxious for some idea of what's going on inside me. Dx 10/6/2008, IDC, 4cm, Stage IIA, Grade 2, 0/3 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Chemotherapy 12/16/2008 AC Chemotherapy 2/3/2009 Taxol (paclitaxel) Radiation Therapy 4/15/2009 Breast Hormonal Therapy 5/30/2009 Dx 10/24/2012, 6cm+, Stage IV, mets, ER+/PR-, HER2- Targeted Therapy 11/4/2012 Avastin (bevacizumab) Chemotherapy 11/4/2012 Taxol (paclitaxel) Chemotherapy 9/22/2013 Xeloda (capecitabine) Hormonal Therapy 3/9/2014 Arimidex (anastrozole) Chemotherapy 6/24/2014 Halaven (eribulin) Chemotherapy 8/17/2014 Carboplatin (Paraplatin), Gemzar (gemcitabine) Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Liver Mets: pain worsening after two cycles DancingVeggie redwolf8812

Posts.Content: DancingVeggie wrote: Hiya! Wondering if there are any north side Chicago mothers of school-aged children out there who might be interested in setting up some kind of help swap, especially as the school year starts to roll around. I know that I could benefit from having someone picking my kids up after school on treatment and scan days and I would be so glad to return the favor. What do you think about this? I live in Irving Park and my children go to school in Lakeview. Is this crazy? Dx 10/6/2008, IDC, 4cm, Stage IIA, Grade 2, 0/3 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Chemotherapy 12/16/2008 AC Chemotherapy 2/3/2009 Taxol (paclitaxel) Radiation Therapy 4/15/2009 Breast Hormonal Therapy 5/30/2009 Dx 10/24/2012, 6cm+, Stage IV, mets, ER+/PR-, HER2- Targeted Therapy 11/4/2012 Avastin (bevacizumab) Chemotherapy 11/4/2012 Taxol (paclitaxel) Chemotherapy 9/22/2013 Xeloda (capecitabine) Hormonal Therapy 3/9/2014 Arimidex (anastrozole) Chemotherapy 6/24/2014 Halaven (eribulin) Chemotherapy 8/17/2014 Carboplatin (Paraplatin), Gemzar (gemcitabine) Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Chicago Moms: Chemo Carpool? DancingVeggie EnglishMajor

Posts.Content: DancingVeggie wrote: Seeking oncologist in the city of Chicago who is progressive, holistic, and will collaborate with other medical providers to help address issues outside the immediate realm of Stage IV breast cancer. Do you love your oncologist? Tell me about them! Thank you!
